Package model

Class ModelOrchestrator

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.ModelOrchestrator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Orchestrator
    public class ModelOrchestrator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Orchestrator
    Our model orchestrator class, as the name suggests, it is the link for the controller to call the internal model classes and provide abstraction to the functionalities of our application. It implements the Orchestrator interface.

      Takes in (Stocks,Quantity) CSV data, generates a random portfolio ID and then saves it (CSV data) in a file.
      java.lang.String generatePortfolioID()
      generate a 6 digit random portfolio number for the application
      java.lang.String getPortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioID)
      Gets the portfolio data as string given a portfolio ID.
      java.lang.String getPortfolioValue​(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String data)
      Fetches Portfolio Value as CSV Data in string format (stock,quantity,value) given a date and portfolio data (in CSV).
      java.lang.String loadExternalCSV​(java.lang.String path)
      Loads an external CSV: firstly reads the given path to CSV file and then writes it into the './app_data/PortfolioData' directory with a generated Portfolio ID.
      java.lang.String[] showExistingPortfolios()
      Shows the existing portfolios in './app_data/PortfolioData' where our application is programmed to store all Portfolios.

      • getPortfolioValue

        public java.lang.String getPortfolioValue​(java.lang.String date,
                                          java.lang.String data)
                                   throws java.text.ParseException
        Fetches Portfolio Value as CSV Data in string format (stock,quantity,value) given a date and portfolio data (in CSV). Since weekend data is unavailble for stocks, returns null if given date is a weekend.
        Specified by:
        getPortfolioValue in interface Orchestrator
        Parameters:
        date - string like date in YYYY-MM-DD format
        data - string like CSV data of the portfolio (Stock,Quantity)
        Returns:
        CSV Data (Stock,Quantity,Value) in string format/ null if date is weekend
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - throws when it's unable to read the given date/data

      • showExistingPortfolios

        public java.lang.String[] showExistingPortfolios()
        Shows the existing portfolios in './app_data/PortfolioData' where our application is programmed to store all Portfolios. Also creates the mentioned directory if not present.
        Specified by:
        showExistingPortfolios in interface Orchestrator
        Returns:
        List of string containing the portfolio names/null if no portfolios found

      • loadExternalCSV

        public java.lang.String loadExternalCSV​(java.lang.String path)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Loads an external CSV: firstly reads the given path to CSV file and then writes it into the './app_data/PortfolioData' directory with a generated Portfolio ID.
        Specified by:
        loadExternalCSV in interface Orchestrator
        Parameters:
        path - path to CSV existing on your file system
        Returns:
        Success/error message depending on if the CSV load was successful or not
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws when the given CSV file is not found/unable to reach it
